articles.author: Mike Stone, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The decision is a major change in U.S. policy and comes as Donald Trump, who has promised to limit further support for Ukraine, prepares to take office.
articles.title: Biden allows Ukraine to use US arms to strike inside Russia

articles.author: Jake Spring, Lisandra Paraguassu
articles.description: Diplomatic tensions over global warming will take center stage at the G20 summit in Brazil this week, as negotiators at U.N. talks in Azerbaijan hit an impasse on climate finance that they hope leaders of the world's 20 major economies can break.
articles.title: World looks to G20 in Rio for breakthrough in climate talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli strike on a building in central Beirut on Sunday killed Hezbollah's media relations chief Mohammad Afif, two Lebanese security sources told Reuters, though there was no immediate confirmation from the Iran-backed group.
articles.title: Hezbollah media head killed in Israeli strike on Beirut, security sources say

articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: A Russian air strike on Ukraine on Sunday shook a fragile consensus among the Group of 20 major economies drafting their joint statement at an annual leaders summit in Rio de Janeiro, three diplomats familiar with the talks told Reuters.
articles.title: Russian air strikes shake fragile G20 consensus ahead of summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peru's president signed defense and mining cooperation deals with her Japanese counterpart on Sunday, following an official visit between the two leaders just after the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit hosted by Lima.
articles.title: Peru, Japan strengthen ties with defense and mining agreements

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Blasts rang out across Ukraine's capital Kyiv and other cities early on Sunday, as Russia staged its biggest missile attack since August and targeted power facilities with the winter setting in, officials said.
articles.title: Russia targets Ukraine's power grid in 'massive' missile strike, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gabonese voters approved a new constitution by a landslide 91.8%, the interior minister said on Sunday, after a referendum that the junta in power promised would be a steppingstone to democratic rule.
articles.title: Gabon votes yes to new constitution, says interior minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ten people, including two children, were killed and 52 were injured on Sunday night when a Russian missile hit a residential nine-storey building in Ukraine's northeastern region of Sumy, Ukraine's emergency services and military said.
articles.title: Two children among 10 killed in Russian missile strike on Sumy, Ukraine says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: Joe Biden meets Chinese president Xi Jinping for the last time as U.S. president on Saturday, but the leaders' goal of lowering tensions before Donald Trump's inauguration is challenged by fresh conflicts over cyber crime, trade, Taiwan and Russia.
articles.title: Biden, Xi set for tense final meeting in Peru as Trump era looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Washington's decision to let Kyiv strike deep into Russia with long-range U.S. missiles escalates the conflict in Ukraine and could lead to World War Three, senior Russian lawmakers said on Sunday.
articles.title: Ukraine strikes on Russia with US missiles could lead to world war, Russian lawmakers say
